We use the new SM data retrieved from L-band microwave observations from the first-dedicated SM mission SMOS (Soil Moisture and Ocean Salinity) satellite (SMOS-IC product version) over 2010–2016. We also used earlier SM observations (1979–2008) from the first ever long-term satellite-based SM product prepared by the ESA’s Climate Change Initiative (CCI)
36 ; http://www.esa-soilmoisture-cci.org/. To make the comparison to the biases in air temperature and precipitation more robust, we also used multiple observational datasets for both variables: (i) Climatic Research Unit (CRU) air temperature and precipitation; (ii) University of Delaware (i.e., “Willmott”) global land air temperature; and (iii) Global Precipitation Climatology Project (GPCP) land precipitation. More details on these datasets and their processing are provided in the Methods section.
